formula: a(2^k+i)=i for 1<=i<=2^(k-1); a(3*2^k+i)=2^k-i for 1<=i<=2^k; sum(k=1, n, a(k))/n^2 is bounded. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Aug 17 2002a(n) = min(n-2^floor(log(n)/log(2)), 2*2^floor(log(n)/log(2))-n). - _Klaus Brockhaus_, Mar 08 2003
example: a(10)=2 since 8 is closest power of 2 to 10 and |8-10|=2
